intro: Eugenia hammelii, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a glossy surface. Eugenia hammelii is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and plays a role in the local ecosystem.
